property.name: Text
property.value: Fast. Play when you activate the Fight ability on a Firearm asset. You may spend X additional ammo tokens from that asset. When you reveal chaos tokens for this attack, reveal X additional tokens. Choose one to resolve and ignore the rest.

property.name: Text
property.value: ι When damage is assigned to Armor of Ardennes, exhaust Armor of Ardennes: Cancel 1 of that damage.

property.name: Text
property.value: Play Eidetic Memory as an exact copy of an Insight event in any investigator's discard pile (including its resource cost). Remove that event from the game. Remove Eidetic Memory from the game instead of discarding it.

property.name: Text
property.value: Fast. Play during any θ player window. Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator searches his or her deck for a card, draws it, and shuffles his or her deck.

property.name: Text
property.value: When earning experience during the resolution of a scenario, if you were not defeated during that scenario, you earn 2 additional experience. If you were defeated during that scenario, you are killed.

property.name: Text
property.value: Playing Lupara does not provoke attacks of opportunity. η Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +1 ή and deal +1 damage for this attack. If Lupara entered play this turn, you get and additional +1 ή and deal an additional +1 damage for this attack.

property.name: Text
property.value: Fast. Play when you would be defeated. Disengage from each enemy engaged with you, discard all cards in your threat area, heal 2 horror and 2 damage, and move to any revealed location with no enemies. If it is your turn, end your turn. Remove Cheat Death from the game.

property.name: Text
property.value: Fast. Play immediately after an investigator at your location finishes resolving an action during his or her turn. Undo that action (return the game state to exactly the way it was before that action was performed, including that action’s cost).

property.name: Text
property.value: Do not reveal chaos tokens from the chaos bag for this test. Treat the chaos token revealed for this test as an ε. When this test ends, remove Seal of the Elder Sign from the game.

property.name: Text
property.value: You get +2 έ while investigating if you have no clues. ι When you would discover 1 or more clues at your location, if you have no clues: Discover an additional clue at your location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Fast. Play after the enemy phase begins. Cancel all attacks made by non-Elite enemies against you this phase.

property.name: Text
property.value: You get +1 to each of your skills for each horror on Key of Ys. Forced – When any amount of horror would be placed on you: Place 1 of that horror on Key of Ys. Forced – When Key of Ys leaves play: Discard the top 10 cards of your deck.

property.name: Text
property.value: Easy / Standard α: -2 (-4 instead if you have no sanity remaining). β: Reveal another token. If you fail, take 1 horror. γ: -3. If you fail and Hastur is in play, place 1 clue on your location (from the token bank). δ: -3. If this token is revealed during an attack or evasion attempt against a Monster or Ancient One enemy, lose 1 action.

property.name: Text
property.value: Hard / Expert α: -X. X is the amount of horror on you. β: Reveal another token. If you fail, take 2 horror. γ: -5. If you fail and Hastur is in play, place 1 clue on your location (from the token bank). δ: -5. If this token is revealed during an attack or evasion attempt against a Monster or Ancient One enemy, lose 1 action.

property.name: Text
property.value: Hastur cannot be defeated. Forced – If there is at least 3π damage on Hastur: Advance this agenda.

property.name: Text
property.value: The investigators must decide (choose one): —Any investigator tests ά (4) to snap out of it. If successful, advance to agenda 2a. If failed, you must choose an option you have yet to choose. —Any investigator tests έ (4) to remember that you’ve done this before. If successful, advance to agenda 2a. If failed, you must choose an option you have yet to choose. —This can’t be real. This can’t be real. This can’t be real. Each investigator takes 2 horror. Advance to agenda 2a. —The investigators faint and awaken some time later. Advance to agenda 2a and place 1 doom on it.

property.name: Text
property.value: Hastur gets +1 fight and cannot be defeated. Forced – If there is at least 5π damage on Hastur: Advance this agenda.

property.name: Text
property.value: Spawn the set-aside Beast of Aldebaran enemy at the Palace of the King. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.

property.name: Text
property.value: Hastur gets +2 fight. Hastur cannot be defeated unless you “know the secret.”

property.name: Text
property.value: Check Campaign Log. —If you have more (or equal) Conviction than Doubt, proceed to (->R4). —If you have more Doubt than Conviction, proceed to (->R5).

property.name: Text
property.value: Objective – When the investigators have collected the requisite number of clues, they must immediately spend them and advance.

property.name: Text
property.value: Spawn the set-aside The Man in the Pallid Mask enemy at the Palace of the King.

property.name: Text
property.value: Each investigator cannot discover clues. The Man in the Pallid Mask cannot be defeated. Objective – While the lead investigator is at The Man in the Pallid Mask’s location, he or she may spend ηηη to advance.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Put The Pallid Mask into play, under the lead investigator’s control. Remove The Man in the Pallid Mask from the game. Spawn the set-aside Hastur (Lord of Carcosa) enemy at the Palace of the King. The Pallid Mask cannot leave play. You get –2 sanity.

property.name: Text
property.value: Each investigator cannot discover clues. The Man in the Pallid Mask cannot be defeated except by his η ability. Objective – When The Man in the Pallid Mask would be defeated by his η ability, advance.

property.name: Text
property.value: Put the set-aside Hastur (The King in Yellow) enemy into play next to the act deck. For the remainder of the scenario, Hastur is considered to be in play but is not at any location. Remove The Man in the Pallid Mask from the game.

property.name: Text
property.value: Each investigator cannot discover clues. The Man in the Pallid Mask cannot be defeated except by damage. Objective – When The Man in the Pallid Mask would be defeated by damage, advance.

property.name: Text
property.value: Spawn the set-aside Hastur (Lord of Carcosa) enemy at The Man in the Pallid Mask’s location. Remove The Man in the Pallid Mask from the game.

property.name: Text
property.value: θ If there are no clues on your location: Remove each investigator’s clues from the game. Flip your location over and resolve the text on the other side. Objective – If Hastur is defeated, advance.

property.name: Text
property.value: —If Hastur (The Tattered King) was the version of Hastur that was defeated, proceed to (->R1). —If Hastur (The King in Yellow) was the version of Hastur that was defeated, proceed to (->R2). —If Hastur (Lord of Carcosa) was the version of Hastur that was defeated, proceed to (->R3).

alternate.name: Songs That the Hyades Shall Sing

property.name: Text
property.value: Deal 1π damage to Hastur, exhaust him, and disengage him from all investigators. Flip this card back over. For the remainder of the game, it cannot be flipped over again.

property.name: Text
property.value: While you are at Bleak Plains, you cannot play Ally assets.

property.name: Text
property.value: Each investigator heals 3 horror. Deal 4 damage to an enemy in play other than Hastur. Remove this card from the game, and replace it with another set-aside copy of Bleak Plains (move all investigators, enemies, and attachments from this location to the new copy of Bleak Plains). Add clues to that copy of Bleak Plains until it has clues on it equal to its clue value.

property.name: Text
property.value: While you are at Bleak Plains, you cannot play Ally assets.

property.name: Text
property.value: Deal 2π damage to Hastur.Flip this card back over. For the remainder of the game, it cannot be flipped over again.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced - After you discover the last remaining clue on Ruins of Carcosa: Take 1 damage.

property.name: Text
property.value: Each investigator heals 3 horror. Remove this card from the game, and replace it with another set-aside copy of Ruins of Carcosa (move all investigators, enemies, and attachments from this location to the new copy of Ruins of Carcosa). Add clues to that copy of Ruins of Carcosa until it has clues on it equal to its clue value.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced - After you discover the last remaining clue on Ruins of Carcosa: Take 1 damage.

property.name: Text
property.value: You must decide (choose one): –Choose an enemy in play. Exhaust that enemy and disengage it from all investigators. –You heal 5 horror. Remove this card from the game, and replace it with another set-aside copy of Ruins of Carcosa (move all investigators, enemies, and attachments from this location to the new copy of Ruins of Carcosa). Add clues to that copy of Ruins of Carcosa until it has clues on it equal to its clue value.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced - After you discover the last remaining clue on Ruins of Carcosa: Take 1 damage.

property.name: Text
property.value: Deal 1π damage to Hastur. Flip this card back over. For the remainder of the game, it cannot be flipped over again.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced - After you discover the last remaining clue on Dim Streets: Lose 1 action.

property.name: Text
property.value: Test έ (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 horror. Deal 1π damage to Hastur regardless of whether you succeed or fail. After this test ends, flip this card back over. For the remainder of the game, it cannot be flipped over again.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced - After you discover the last remaining clue on Dim Streets: Lose 1 action.

property.name: Text
property.value: Test ή (2). If you succeed, exhaust Hastur and disengage him from all investigators. Remove this card from the game, and replace it with another set-aside copy of Dim Streets (move all investigators, enemies, and attachments from this location to the new copy of Dim Streets). Add clues to that copy of Dim Streets until it has clues on it equal to its clue value.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced - After you discover the last remaining clue on Dim Streets: Lose 1 action.

property.name: Text
property.value: Test ά (1). For each point you succeed by, heal 1 horror. Remove this card from the game, and replace it with another set-aside copy of Dim Streets (move all investigators, enemies, and attachments from this location to the new copy of Dim Streets). Add clues to that copy of Dim Streets until it has clues on it equal to its clue value.

property.name: Text
property.value: While you are at Depths of Demhe, you cannot play fast cards.

property.name: Text
property.value: Each investigator heals 5 horror. Remove this card from the game, and replace it with another set-aside copy of Depths of Demhe (move all investigators, enemies, and attachments from this location to the new copy of Depths of Demhe). Add clues to that copy of Depths of Demhe until it has clues on it equal to its clue value.

property.name: Text
property.value: While you are at Depths of Demhe, you cannot play fast cards.

property.name: Text
property.value: Deal 1π damage to Hastur, exhaust him, and disengage him from all investigators. Flip this card back over. For the remainder of the game, it cannot be flipped over again.

property.name: Text
property.value: You must decide (choose one): – You cannot bring yourself to do what must be done. Flip this card back over. – Realizing what you must do, you step forward and push her. Take 2 horror and deal 2π damage to Hastur. Flip this card back over. For the remainder of the game, it cannot be flipped over again.

property.name: Text
property.value: Palace of the King cannot be flipped over unless Hastur has at least 5π damage on him.

property.name: Text
property.value: Remember that you “know the secret.” Flip this card back over. For the remainder of the game, it cannot be flipped over again.

property.name: Text
property.value: Cannot be damaged except by story card effects. Forced – At the beginning of the enemy phase, if Hastur is ready: Hastur attacks each investigator, in player order (regardless of their location). If Hastur’s attack deals you horror in excess of your sanity, you take 1 damage, as well. η: Test ά (X), where X is Hastur’s fight value. If you succeed, exhaust Hastur. Any investigator may trigger this action.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Prey – Most remaining sanity. Hunter. Massive.

property.name: Text
property.value: If Hastur’s attack deals you horror in excess of your sanity, you take 1 damage, as well. While Hastur is being attacked or evaded by an investigator with no remaining sanity, treat each ε, “+1,” “0,” or “–1” token that investigator reveals as a ζ token.

property.name: Text
property.value: If Hastur’s attack deals you horror in excess of your sanity, you take 1 damage, as well. While Hastur is being attacked or evaded by an investigator with no remaining sanity, treat each ε, “+1,” “0,” or “–1” token that investigator reveals as a ζ token.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced – When Creature out of Demhe’s location or a connecting location is flipped over, if Creature out of Demhe is ready: It attacks each investigator at that location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced – After a location is flipped over, if Winged One is ready and unengaged: Move it once toward that location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Test ά (3). If you have no remaining sanity, this test gets +2 difficulty. If you fail, take 2 damage (4 damage instead if you have horror on you greater than twice your sanity).

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Discard cards from play and/or from your hand with a total printed resource cost of at least X, where X is the amount of horror on your investigator. If no cards are discarded by this effect, take 2 horror.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – If you have no remaining sanity, place 2 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Secretly add Possession (Traitorous) to your hand. If you have horror on you greater than twice your sanity, you are immediately eliminated and killed. You may commit this card to a skill test at your location. That test automatically fails.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Secretly add Possession (Torturous) to your hand. If you have horror on you greater than twice your sanity, you are immediately eliminated and killed. η Spend 5 resources: Discard Possession (Torturous) from your hand.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Secretly add Possession (Murderous) to your hand. If you have horror on you greater than twice your sanity, you are immediately eliminated and killed. η Deal 2 damage to an investigator at your location: Discard Possession (Murderous) from your hand.
